article.h1: Notifying assessments in particular situations: notifying a decision by written demand

div.p: The replacement in 1997 and 1998 of various powers of recovery with powers of assessment means that the only situation where it may be necessary to notify a decision by demand is where drawback is cancelled. Please contact the Specialist Technical Team, see CH910000 Link: https://www.gov.uk/hmrc-internal-manuals/compliance-handbook/ch910000 ,Â TAA Central Policy if you consider it necessary to notify a decision by demand in any other circumstances.

Where, exceptionally, it is necessary to notify a decision by demand, our policy is to limit it to both the four-year rule applicable to the period of duty and the one-year rule for making assessments.

These time limits only apply to written demands that notify a decision to recover money. They do not apply to demands that may be issued as part of normal debt management procedures resulting from non-payment of assessments.
